title: Introduction to ResNatSeed
text: ResNatSeed R package compute suitability certain seed mixture site seeds sown restoration purposes degraded site.

title: Introduction to ResNatSeed
text: restoration site: degraded site needs restored sowing donor grassland: grassland plant material harvested (e.g. brushing) provide native seeds restoration sites vegetation topographical variables database: dataframe containing composition set vegetation surveys corresponding topographic variables (elevation, slope aspect) training database: dataframe species eligible statistical modelling, selected basis frequency abundance vegetation topographical variables database. species associated values topographic variables (elevation, slope aspect) abundance. species codes - CEP names: eight-letter abbreviation species names according Cornell Ecology Programs (CEP). [vegan]{make.cepnames} seed mixture donor grassland composition: ‘seed mixture’ list species abundance seed batch. ‘donor grassland composition’ list species abundance surveyed grassland native seeds harvested. topographical variables restoration site: values elevation, slope, aspect degraded site needs restored sowing. Suitability Index (SI): suitability seed mixture donor grassland restore site specific topographic characteristics. ranges 0 1. SI=0 restoration site totally beyond optimal ecological ranges species seed mixture donor grassland, therefore appropriate site restoration. Conversely, SI=1 restoration site optimal ecological conditions species seed mixture donor grassland, therefore perfectly appropriate site restoration. Reliability Index (RI): index reliability Suitability Index (SI). RI ranges 0 1. RI close 0 means none species contribute computation SI, whereas RI close 1 SI computed species. Therefore, higher RI, reliable SI. species seed mixture donor grassland composition may modeled ) can missing training database ii) values topographic factors restoration site beyond ecological ranges (e.g. elevation restoration site 250 m species elevation range bounded 1000 3000 m, species modeled).

title: Introduction to ResNatSeed
text: ResNatSeed can used R environment ShinyApp. information available “Package installation ShinyApp” vignette. ResNatSeed can operate two different ways depending source training database (.e. default customized one): DEFAULT training database based vegetation data collected Piedmont Region (North Western Italy). See vignette TUTORIAL 1 - Default training database operational details. CUSTOMIZED training database can based vegetation database belonging geographical area. See vignette TUTORIAL 2 - Customized training database operational details.

what: A tool for the assessment of the REStoration potential of NATive SEEDs based on topographic factors
title: A tool for the assessment of the REStoration potential of NATive SEEDs based on topographic factors
text: ResNatSeed R package Shiny web app predict REStoration potential NATive SEEDs using topographic factors. United Nations Decade Ecosystem Restoration highlighting importance restoring ecosystems trying overcome actual limitations process. ResNatSeed born overcome problem subjectivity assessment suitability native seeds site must restored. package allows assess restoration potential native seeds restoration site using topographic factors . input data composition seed mixture donor grassland elevation, slope, aspect restoration site. topographic factors easily retrievable field Geographic Information System (GIS) software. suitability species mixture restoring site based modeling large database vegetation surveys, characterized botanical composition associated abovementioned topographic factors. database can either default one, related Piedmont Region (NW Italy), provided user allow usage ResNatSeed geographical area. restoration potential expressed two synthetic indexes (named Suitability Index Reliability Index ), readily interpretable well range 0 (low suitability realiability) 1 (high suitability realiability).

what: List of plant species for the seed mixture or donor grassland composition with the default training database — cep.piem
title: List of plant species for the seed mixture or donor grassland composition with the default training database — cep.piem
text: dataframe 248 plant species name abbreviation (CEP names) Piedmont Region (North Western Italy) suitable modeling data argument trainingDB function NULL. list possible create mixture donor grassland composition database.

title: List of plant species for the seed mixture or donor grassland composition with the default training database — cep.piem
List of plant species for the seed mixture or donor grassland composition with the default training database — cep.piem
text: dataframe 248 rows 2 variables: species Species names according Aeschimann et al 2004 cep.names Abbreviation species names according Cornell Ecology Programs (CEP), uses eight-letter abbreviations species. See make.cepnames details

title: List of plant species for the seed mixture or donor grassland composition with the default training database — cep.piem
text: Aeschimann, D., Lauber, K., Moser, M. D., & Theurillat, J. P. (2004). Flora alpina (Flora Alps). Zanichelli, Bologna.

what: ResNatSeed: A tool for the assessment of the REStoration potential of NATive SEEDs based on topographic factors — ResNatSeed-package
title: ResNatSeed: A tool for the assessment of the REStoration potential of NATive SEEDs based on topographic factors — ResNatSeed-package
text: ResNatSeed R package compute suitability certain seed mixture site seeds sown restoration purposes degraded site.

title: ResNatSeed: A tool for the assessment of the REStoration potential of NATive SEEDs based on topographic factors — ResNatSeed-package
text: Maintainer: Marco Pittarello marco.pittarello1987@gmail.com (ORCID) Authors: Davide Barberis davide.barberis@unito.

what: Computation of Suitability Index (SI) and Reliability Index (RI) — RestInd
title: Computation of Suitability Index (SI) and Reliability Index (RI) — RestInd
text: function allows compute Suitability Index (SI) Reliability Index (RI) seed mixture donor grassland composition used restoration site based topographic features: elevation, slope aspect. see vignettes additional details examples

title: Computation of Suitability Index (SI) and Reliability Index (RI) — RestInd
code: RestInd(trainingDB = NULL, composition, elevation, slope, aspect)

title: Computation of Suitability Index (SI) and Reliability Index (RI) — RestInd
text: trainingDB dataframe species eligible statistical modelling, selected basis frequency abundance vegetation topographical variables database. species associated values topographic variables (elevation, slope aspect) abundance. Default NULL. NULL, training database derived 4081 vegetation surveys carried Piedmont Region, (North-Western Italy), includes 248 plant species eligible modeling. customized training database can generated trainingDB. composition dataframe seed mixture donor grassland composition. consists two columns: 1) species code abbreviated CEP names format 2) abundance species. "trainingDB" NULL, species CEP names retrievable cep.piem data. "trainingDB" NULL, .e. user use default settings, species CEP names retrievable trainingDB, generates CEP names species suitable modeling customized training database. elevation Elevation restoration site, expressed meters sea level (m .s.l.) slope Slope restoration site, expressed degrees (°) aspect Aspect restoration site, expressed degrees North (°N)

title: Computation of Suitability Index (SI) and Reliability Index (RI) — RestInd
text: list three outputs: DESCRIPTIVES: dataframe descriptive information related modeled plant species: cep.names Species name CEP format species Full species name n.obs Number observations species selected modeling min.ele Minimum elevation species occurred max.ele Maximum elevation species occurred min.slope Minimum slope species occurred max.slope Maximum slope species occurred min.south Minimum southness value species occurred max.south Maximum southness value species occurred SPECIES ABUNDANCES: dataframe following information: cep.names Species name CEP format species Full species name PMA Predicted Maximum Abundance. maximum achievable abundance species restoration site, predicted best model POA Predicted Optimal Abundance. maximum achievable abundance species optimal ecological condition, based possible combinations elevation, slope southness. ratio Ratio PMA POA. ratio indicates far (ratio = 0) close (ratio = 1) species ecological optimum. R2.adj R square adjusted best Generalized Additive Model RMSE Root Mean Squared Error best Generalized Additive Model SmDgA Seed mixture Donor grassland Abundance. Abundance species listed seed mixture donor grassland composition imported user eligible modeling EA Expected Abundance. highest achievable abundance species restoration site, based far species ecological optimum (.e. computed multiplication SmDgA ratio) INDEXES: SI Suitability Index (SI). Suitability seed mixture donor grassland restore site specific topographic characteristics. ranges 0 1. SI=0 restoration site totally beyond optimal ecological ranges species seed mixture donor grassland, therefore appropriate site restoration. Conversely, SI=1 restoration site optimal ecological conditions species seed mixture donor grassland, therefore perfectly appropriate site restoration. RI Reliability Index (RI). Index reliability Suitability Index (SI). RI ranges 0 1. RI close 0 means none species contribute computation SI, whereas RI close 1 SI computed species. Therefore, higher RI, reliable SI. species seed mixture donor grassland composition may modeled ) can missing training database ii) values topographic factors restoration site beyond ecological ranges (e.g. elevation restoration site 250 m species elevation range bounded 1000 3000 m, species modeled).

title: Computation of Suitability Index (SI) and Reliability Index (RI) — RestInd
code: #creation of seed mixture dataframe by retrieving species CEP names from ResNatSeed::cep.piem mixture_composition<-data.frame(species=c("Festrubr","Chaehirs","Phleprat","Onobmont"),                                sc=c(5,40,20,20)) #run function ResNatSeed::RestInd(trainingDB = NULL,                     composition = mixture_composition,                     elevation = 1500,                     aspect = 30,                     slope = 5) #> $DESCRIPTIVES #>          cep.names                species n.obs min.ele max.ele min.slope #> Chaehirs  Chaehirs Chaerophyllum hirsutum    43     623    2248         2 #> Festrubr  Festrubr          Festuca rubra    60     494    2743         2 #> Onobmont  Onobmont     Onobrychis montana    40    1395    2501      0.97 #> Phleprat  Phleprat        Phleum pratense    51     848    2439       2.6 #>          max.slope min.south max.south #> Chaehirs        49       4.2       178 #> Festrubr        51      0.33       180 #> Onobmont        45       2.5       177 #> Phleprat        43         9       179 #>  #> $SPECIES_ABUNDANCES #>   cep.names                species  PMA  POA ratio R2.adj RMSE SmDgA   EA #> 1  Chaehirs Chaerophyllum hirsutum 50.0 57.7  0.87   0.27 14.7    40 34.8 #> 2  Festrubr          Festuca rubra 90.4 96.4  0.94   0.89  8.5     5  4.7 #> 3  Onobmont     Onobrychis montana 20.2 85.6  0.24   0.57 15.3    20  4.8 #> 4  Phleprat        Phleum pratense  9.2 34.2  0.27   0.47  8.8    20  5.4 #>  #> $INDEXES #>     SI RI #> 1 0.58  1 #>

title: Customized ResNatSeed training database — trainingDB
text: function creates training database based vegetation topographical variables database provided user, must specified trainingDB argument function RestInd. see vignettes additional details examples

title: Customized ResNatSeed training database — trainingDB
text: data dataframe vegetation topographical variables columns arranged shown @details vignettes. spe.freq threshold minimum frequency species surveys. advisable set values greater equal 30 allow appropriate statistical modeling. min.spe.abundance threshold minimum abundance (greater ) species survey. NULL parameter set 0.

title: Customized ResNatSeed training database — trainingDB
text: list containing two dataframes: dataframe list species suitable modeling species codes (CEP names) used seed mixture donor grassland composition. "cep.names": two-column dataframe reporting full species names abbreviations CEP format (see make.cepnames details). species need indicated (CEP names format) seed mixture donor grassland composition (.e. composition argument RestInd). "trainingDB.ResNatSeed": seven-column dataframe reporting following information: Survey ID, elevation, slope, southness, species full names, species CEP names, species abundance. dataframe must used trainingDB argument RestInd function.

title: Customized ResNatSeed training database — trainingDB
text: format dataframe required data argument must strictly follow column order: SurveyID   |    Elevation   |    Slope   |    Aspect   |    Species1   |    Species2   |    Species3   |    Species… SurveyID contain alphanumeric coding uniquely identify survey Elevation expressed meters sea level (m .s.l.) Slope expressed degrees (°) Aspect expressed degrees North (°N) converted "southness" avoid circular variable issues statistical models RestInd function (Chang et al., 2004) Species... columns containing plant species abundances. Abundances must numbers bounded 0 100, can either species relative abundance species cover (sensu Pittarello et al., 2016; Verdinelli et al.,2022 see vegetation_abundance

title: Customized ResNatSeed training database — trainingDB
text: Chang, C., P. Lee, M. Bai, T. Lin. 2004. Predicting geographical distribution plant communities complex terrain–case study Fushian Experimental Forest, north- eastern Taiwan. Ecography. 27:577–588. doi:10.1111/j.0906- 7590.2004.03852.x Pittarello, M., Probo, M., Lonati, M., Lombardi, G., 2016. Restoration sub-alpine shrub-encroached grasslands pastoral practices: effects vegetation structure botanical composition. Appl Veg Sci 19, 381–390. https://doi.org/10.1111/avsc.12222 Verdinelli, M., Pittarello, M., Caria, M.C., Piga, G., Roggero, P.P., Marrosu, G.M., Arrizza, S., Fadda, M.L., Lombardi, G., Lonati, M., Nota, G., Sitzia, M., Bagella, S., 2022. Congruent responses vascular plant ant communities pastoral land-use abandonment mountain areas throughout different biogeographic regions.
